pros: Like everyone here they are nice
cons: Not enough therapists for the county

review_title: Strained work place with poor employee morale.
job_title: Social Work Case Manager in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Puts you in position to deliver services to adult mentally ill. Working in the field. Some employees help to keep each other motivated.
cons: Aloof leadership, except to bring you criticism. Poor benefits. Poor morale in the office. Most employees do not feel valued by local management or corporate management. Management motivates with threats of write ups and attacking your license  Have to use your own laptop, car, and cell phone. Very little vacation. No vacation the first year. No 401K or 403B. Medical benefits are very difficult for an employee with a family. Little chance of advancement.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Owosso, MI
pros:
Great,friendly and supportive coworkers! 
The ability to help those that need mental health care. I'm basically the liaison for the consumers and Nurse Practitioners. I handle the NP schedules and calls from consumers with medication concerns, and I coordinate care with the Consumers and their PCP. I currently live in Flint, which gives me about a 40 min drive to and from work, but I truly enjoy working here, so it's worth the drive.
cons: I have no Cons for the office I work for. Everyone here is a team player, and does their best to help one another, and help the consumers get the care they need.

pros:
Great Boss
Great co-workers unified team with a true desire to be their best and assist clients to the fullest.
Loved my director who always listened and went to bat for me. Loved Medical Records cause she knew everything and always assisted me. My co-workers were specialist in their own disciplines.
Absolutely the best place I have ever worked.
cons: Corporate office billing department was a total mess multiple mistakes constantly and frequently resulting in loss or delayed wages. Mistakes often had to be grieved or argued on the part of management. Frequent corrections to many to count and to many to excuse.

pros: CSI has many opportunities for flexible schedules and is willing to work around school, second jobs and family. They seek to obtain lots of feedback from staff and colleagues are very friendly. Lots of support is offered and management have experience and compassion.
cons: May not be the best place of employment if you are not driven, and used to a fast paced work environment and multitasking

job_title: Support Coordinator in Sterling Heights, MI
pros: My fellow co-workers were awesome in helping when I had a question.  I also had great consumers.
cons:
Punitive attitude to staff. Unrealistic demands. Management more interested in making money from Medicaid that they do not look to see if employees are billing unnecessary units so they reach their unrealistic demand set by management. Very high turn over. 
Pay is way below what other mental health agencies pay for the same position.

pros: Consumer Services, Inc. offers benefits that can be comparable to other businesses, with having personal and vacation time, along with health insurance, dental, vision, and life insurance. Everyone is very helpful and great to work with. Flexible schedule that is given is awesome!
cons: Communicate changes in a more timely manner. You have to wait for someone to leave the business before the opportunity for advancement is achievable.

review_title: Loved being able to help consumers in day to day lives, absolutely cannot stand disorganized management.
pros:
Got to work with consumers every day, helping them with hand-over-hand assistance, or leading assistance, in various daily tasks. 
My consumers were typically in my area, and I didn't have to go very far to their homes. 
They're very flexible for school schedules. 
Paid mileage.
cons:
Management is very disorganized.
Management lives about an hour away, and on-call managers often do not help with consumers in emergency situations.
On-call managers do not help find replacement staff if staff is unable to find a replacement, even in emergency situations.
On-call managers often ignore phone calls, or are rude when they pick up the phone. 
Managers do not know enough about the company, and questions like, "Is this day a holiday pay day?" are often met with "I don't know" responses.
There is no paid-time-off for part-time associates.
There is no over time, even when you are needed to provide over-time situations, have had them put the extra hours over into the next week, or you lose the hours worked.
There is no sick pay for part-time associates.
There are no raises unless you become management, which is only a $3 raise. Salaried.
Mileage is less than IRS rate, it has been at .50 a mile for the last year, when asked about it raising, management states that they weren't aware of the raise.
There is no proper lifting training.
"Training" consists of a one day orientation where you are adult CPR trained, you are given medication training through WCC, and recipient rights training. You are "inserviced" by co-workers typically for one shift, sometimes two shifts, and then expected to be able to know everything to do with their care. On-call management typically will answer questions here, but, get annoyed fast.

pros: Good communication with co-workers, fast paced work environment, and new counselors will have a full case load within one month.
cons: Pay was on the lower end for professional counselors and there are more consumers that need mental health services than there are available counselors.

pros: Their "desire" to equip case managers with thorough training and effective supervision. Their mission to serve clients.
cons: They are not able to effectively meet their objectives and do not really listen to the needs of employees.  Very limited supplies to do work.

pros: The employees and the clients are great!
cons: Poor management, nepotism, you will a contractor but treated as an employee. Salaries are poor,  as are benefits (none if you are a contractor). Areas of growth available if willing to accept increased responsibility with poor complication.

job_title: Supports Coordinator in Grosse Pointe Park, MI
pros: Telecommuting and offered a flexible schedule. Friendly atmosphere. Adequate resources.
cons: Company decided to go from contractual to permanent hire and wanted to offer experienced employees insulting salaries. Very amateur-ish.

pros: Lots of consumers and fair benefit package
cons: Poor culture, leadership and support from supervision

job_title: Supports Coordinator in Sterling Heights, MI
pros: Working with the clients and their families. Some of the seasoned support coordinators were helpful with questions. You were able to make your own schedule.
cons: Very poor management. The office staff was very lazy and would take super long lunches. The caseloads were unmanageable. Leads were never helpful and did not offer any good feedback.

pros: Good co-workers and fair distribution of tasks.
cons: Limited health benefits. Too many meeting.

review_title: the worst agency in Genesee County
job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Flint, MI
pros: The bonuses you have to kill you self to get.
cons: Every other thing about this agency

review_title: Company is struggling due to lack of organization
pros: I love my supervisor and coworkers.
cons: Absolutely everything about this job is not what I was lead to believe in the beginning.
